image.altText: David Pocock press conference

props.synopsis: The ANU's leadership is increasingly under fire and now a senator has urged the council to "get on with it".

title.children: ‘Lost the faith’: Pocock calls for urgent ANU leadership change

image.altText: Megan leans onto a stool she's sitting on, looking thoughtful.

props.synopsis: A survey of women in Canberra about the state of their wellbeing and health reveals large gaps in access and affordability, as well as the staggering statistic that almost half of respondents felt doctors weren't taking them seriously.

title.children: 'Jarring to have my experience dismissed': Women report low healthcare satisfaction

image.altText: Composite of pop star Katy Perry wear oragne outfit with white background, left, with Sydney fashion designer Katie Perry, right

props.synopsis: Pop singer Katy Perry and Australian designer Katie Perry have been locked in a dispute over trademarking of their products since 2009.

title.children: High Court to decide on Katie Perry's trademark claim against Katy Perry

image.altText: A man with dark hair and glasses in a suit.

props.synopsis: Former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann has lodged legal action in the Federal Court against the Commissioner of the National Anti-Corruption Commission and a federal minister.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann wades into new Federal Court battle

image.altText: Canberra Raiders player Josh Papalii with his hands on hips, grimacing

props.synopsis: Canberra enforcer Josh Papalii is in serious doubt for the Raiders' qualifying final against Brisbane after suffering an ankle injury at training.

title.children: Raiders leader in moon boot, Broncos captain confident of finals return

image.altText: A skateboarder on the top of a brick wall.

props.synopsis: The city of Canberra may only be 112 years old, but it has many things worth preserving, like a brick skate park in the south, and pine trees and 1960s flats in the north. But there can be hurdles to recognising and preserving heritage as the city grows.

title.children: It accidentally became a skateboarding mecca. Now it's up for heritage listing

image.altText: A handgun with a label tied to it.

props.synopsis: The ACT Firearms Registry remains mostly paper based. Both police and the government say the "very analogue" system needs to go fully digital as soon as possible.

title.children: 'Loopholes and lags': The ACT's gun registry is still mostly paper based

image.altText: Telstra Tower in Canberra from an aerial view.

props.synopsis: A budget deficit and proportionally high debt, along with rising health costs and major infrastructure projects, see ACT's credit rating downgraded to AA.

title.children: Budget deficit and high debt see ACT's credit rating downgraded to AA

image.altText: Hero postcard

props.synopsis: Georgia Curry bought a postcard from an op-shop after the cursive writing and old stamp caught her attention. It unlocked a 79-year-old mystery she is still getting to the bottom of.

title.children: A funky stamp led Georgia to buy an old postcard. She says it was fate

image.altText: A drawing of the Manhattan skyline in bold gold marker, featuring cars on a road and little stick figures among the buildings.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's alleged 2003 letter to Jeffrey Epstein shares similarities to other drawings and correspondence he has produced.

title.children: How Trump's alleged Epstein note compares to his previous drawings and letters

image.altText: Two men in suits shaking hands

props.synopsis: A landmark $500 million agreement to "transform" the relationship between Australia and Vanuatu still hangs in the balance as Prime Minister Anthony Albanese flies to the Pacific Island nation.

title.children: Albanese flies to Vanuatu for $500m signing ceremony that never happened

image.altText: former thai prime minister thaksin shinawatra gestures with his hands to a crowd of people

props.synopsis: He was previously sentenced to eight years in prison on conflicts of interest and abuse of power charges.

title.children: Former Thai PM Thaksin Shinawatra ordered to serve one year in jail

image.altText: A Socceroos forward grins while carrying a teammate on his back, celebrating a goal.

props.synopsis: Mohamed Toure and Nestory Irankunda dazzle after being handed a rare opportunity to start under Tony Popovic as the Socceroos retain the 'Soccer Ashes' with a commanding win over New Zealand in Auckland.

title.children: Irankunda and Toure give Socceroos a World Cup headache after dazzling against NZ

image.altText: A person with the hands hovering beneath a steering wheel in a car that's driving itself through automation.

props.synopsis: An apparent test drive of Tesla's automated self-driving technology in Melbourne's CBD earlier this year was not approved by the Victorian government.

title.children: Tesla self-driving test on busy Melbourne streets 'not approved'

image.altText: Sam Groth and his wife Brittany, who is smiling, at an election party

props.synopsis: The Herald Sun defamed Victorian Deputy Opposition Leader Sam Groth by implying he sexually assaulted his wife when she was a teenager, according to court documents.

title.children: Herald Sun defamed Sam Groth and invaded wife's privacy, MP claims

image.altText: Graeme Lawrence at the child abuse royal commission.

props.synopsis: Former Newcastle Anglican dean Graeme Lawrence has been charged with seven sexual assault offences dating back more than 40 years in the NSW Riverina area.

title.children: Former Anglican dean accused of historical child sexual abuse

image.altText: topless man holds crocodile

props.synopsis: Viral footage of a US social media star handling a deadly saltwater crocodile in Far North Queensland has sparked calls to deport misbehaving influencers.

title.children: Calls for travel ban on risky influencers after croc encounter

image.altText: Emperor Penguin chicks walking along the edge of an ice shelf

props.synopsis: Proposed "geoengineering" projects designed to reduce the impacts of global warming in polar regions would be ineffective, extremely costly and environmentally dangerous, researchers have warned.

title.children: 'Environmentally dangerous': Scientists warn against polar 'geoengineering'

image.altText: The side of Perth Children's Hospital, with a sign showing the building's name.

props.synopsis: High levels of lead detected in the water at Perth Children's Hospital do not pose a risk to patient safety, health authorities say.

title.children: Lead in water at Perth Children's Hospital 'no risk' to safety, says health minister

image.altText: A grainy CCTV still showing a group of men attacking another man inside a prison.

props.synopsis: Three men who pleaded guilty to a pair of vicious assaults on a rival gang member in a NSW prison are set to be sentenced later this month.

title.children: Trio to be sentenced after sandwich press used in brutal prison bashing

image.altText: A group of people in a crowd hold smart phones and signs and appear to be mid-chant.

props.synopsis: After protests in Indonesia turned deadly, Indonesian diaspora communities across the world have held peaceful demonstrations to make the same demands as friends and family back home.

title.children: 'We are all angry': Indonesian protests spread across the world

image.altText: A greyscale image showing a dark silhouette of a boat in water, illuminated by a spotlight and a downward, flame in the sky

props.synopsis: The Global Sumud Flotilla for Gaza says one of its main boats has been struck by a drone in Tunisian waters but all six passengers and crew are safe.

title.children: Flotilla for Gaza says boat struck by drone in Tunisian waters

image.altText: Storm clouds drop heavy rain in the distance on a western Queensland property

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology is making a major change to how they assess El Niño and La Niña, the world's most dominant drivers of weather variability.

title.children: Climate change forces BOM to overhaul El Niño and La Niña analysis

image.altText: Tayla with her fingers up.

props.synopsis: The New South Wales government put Tayla in the residential care system, where the girl with high needs and multiple diagnoses was pulled into a cycle of sexual abuse.

title.children: 'Hate her for this': Ex-state ward says another child exposed her to abuse

image.altText: A apir of mailboxes. One red, one yellow.

props.synopsis: Australia Post is resuming all US shipping within weeks, after the national delivery service found a way to meet new US tariff rules.

title.children: Australia Post to resume US shipping after meeting tariff rules

image.altText: The logo of the ANZ Banking Group is displayed in the window of a newly opened branch in central Sydney

props.synopsis: ANZ announces a restructure that will see thousands of roles go and fewer contracts with consultants and third parties.

title.children: 'This is the right thing to do': ANZ to cut 3,500 jobs in next year

image.altText: Man and woman embrace in selfie photo

props.synopsis: Mercury Psillakis had earned a black belt in Taekwondo and travelled the world surfing, his family reveals in a statement.

title.children: Shark attack victim's death an 'unavoidable accident', family says

image.altText: The minister speaking in a suit at parliament house.

props.synopsis: Australia's education minister believes a new super commission will address rising school dropout rates, but he still needs to convince the states to support a greater federal role, writes Conor Duffy.

title.children: 'We need more students to finish school': Education minister proposes public school shake-up

image.altText: Composite images of Australian track and field athletes Torrie Lewis, Gout Gout and Delta Amidzovski in action

props.synopsis: Armed with the largest team ever assembled for a major athletics meet, Australia enters the World Athletics Championships with a sense of excitement.

title.children: 'Little things' driving Australia's golden generation of athletics stars

image.altText: A woman sits with her head down

props.synopsis: The children's remains were found when the unclaimed suitcases were sold at auction by the facility.

title.children: Mother of two children found dead in suitcases faces court pleads not guilty

image.altText: Hannah Thomas with glasses outside court.

props.synopsis: Hannah Thomas's lawyer, Peter O'Brien, told the magistrate he will pursue costs in relation to the criminal proceedings that have been withdrawn.

title.children: Charges dropped against ex-Greens candidate injured in protest arrest

image.altText: Broughton Street, Singleton

props.synopsis: A 17-year-old girl dies after being attacked by a dog while visiting a friend's home in the Hunter Valley last week.

title.children: Teenage girl dies in hospital after NSW dog attack

image.altText: Investigators work at the scene of an accident where a freight train slammed into a double-deck bus

props.synopsis: CCTV footage shows the bus creeping forward in moving traffic before the train comes through, splitting the bus into two pieces.

title.children: Ten people killed after freight train splits double-decker bus in Mexico

image.altText: The five Spice Girls doing peace signs next to a young Prince Charles, looking embarrassed with a lipstick mark on his cheek

props.synopsis: When Mel C first auditioned for a new girl group in 1994, she had no idea what kind of journey she was about to embark on. She talks to Zan Rowe about the moments that made the Spice Girls.

title.children: How the Spice Girls fired their management and took over the world
